template_01.name: statistics
template_01.main_feature: Present charts and explanations in a personalised canvas. Include bar charts, line charts, doughnut charts and more!

template_02.name: maps
template_02.main_feature: Configure an interactive map, with filters and interactive charts on demand.

template_03.name: timeline
template_03.main_feature: Allow users to manipulate time series data. Incrementally build line charts, bar charts, and bubble charts, by adding/removing filters - and see the chart changing!

template_04.name: relations
template_04.main_feature: Allow users to explore a dataset from an entity and to iteratively perform actions on results of queries.

discover_music_data_on_the_web.title: Discover music data on the Web
discover_music_data_on_the_web.description: musoW is a catalogue of musical resources available on the web realized with the idea to support teachers in music education, creative industries, historians, and musicologists in finding what they need.

dynamic_elements.text: The catalogue includes descriptions of several music-related web resources, with a focus on those that serve or allow users to manipulate music data in any form.

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
PREFIX musow: <https://w3id.org/musow/vocab/> 
SELECT ?x (COUNT(?content) AS ?y) 
WHERE { {?content ?p musow:repository . musow:repository rdfs:label ?x .} UNION {?content ?p musow:catalogue . musow:catalogue rdfs:label ?x .} UNION {?content ?p musow:dataset . musow:dataset rdfs:label ?x .} UNION {?content ?p musow:digital-library . musow:digital-library rdfs:label ?x .} UNION {?content ?p musow:software . musow:software rdfs:label ?x .} } GROUP BY ?x
SELECT ?x (COUNT(?x) AS ?y) WHERE { { SELECT ?time (DAY(?time) AS ?x) WHERE { ?entry <http://www.w3.org/ns/prov#generatedAtTime> ?time . } } } GROUP BY ?x ORDER BY ?x

dynamic_elements.text: While collecting information about resources is important, we also focused on understanding the potential audience of the resources. We discovered that most of surveyed resources are targeted to scholars.

music_datasets.title: Music datasets
music_datasets.description:
musoW is a catalogue of musical resources available on the web realized with the idea to support teachers in music education, creative industries, historians, and musicologists in finding what they need.

Usually scholars and creatives need to combine diverse resources (music scores, audiovisual materials, data) from digital music libraries and audiovisual archives. 

In musoW we support users in searching over hundreds of online resources, including digital libraries, archives, datasets, and related technologies.

explore_another_possibility.title: Explore Another Possibility
explore_another_possibility.description:
Wikidata is a free and open knowledge base that can be read and edited by both humans and machines.

Wikidata acts as central storage for the structured data of its Wikimedia sister projects including Wikipedia, Wikivoyage, Wiktionary, Wikisource, and others.
Wikidata also provides support to many other sites and services beyond just Wikimedia projects! The content of Wikidata is available under a free license, exported using standard formats, and can be interlinked to other open data sets on the linked data web.

relations_between_museums.title: Relations between museums
relations_between_museums.subtitle: Explore relations between artists in museums
relations_between_museums.description: Start a text search for museums you like. Once you found what you like in the list of results, click on the buttons that appear next to the result and keep exploring relations. New tables will appear, including more actions and relations to explore.

nurses'_listening_experiences_during_wwi.title: Nurses' listening experiences during WWI
nurses'_listening_experiences_during_wwi.subtitle: An overview from the LED database
nurses'_listening_experiences_during_wwi.description: An overview of nurses' listening experiences during WWI, including those in which they participated and those that nurses recorded in their journals. Data source: The Listening experience database.

dynamic_elements.count_query:
PREFIX dc: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> 
PREFIX edtf: <http://data.open.ac.uk/edtf/ontology/>
PREFIX edtfdata: <http://data.open.ac.uk/time/edtf/>
PREFIX event: <http://purl.org/NET/c4dm/event.owl#>
PREFIX led: <http://led.kmi.open.ac.uk/term/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
SELECT (COUNT(DISTINCT ?lexp) AS ?count) 
WHERE {
   ?lexp event:time [ rdfs:label ?when ; edtf:century edtfdata:Century.19 ; edtf:yearOfCentury/rdf:value ?yoc ]
   VALUES ?nocc { 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/occupation/nurse> 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/thing/QAIMNS+nurse> 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/thing/VAD+nurse> 
   }
   ?lexp ?p ?nurse
   . ?nurse <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/occupation> ?nocc
   FILTER ( ?yoc >= 14 && ?yoc <= 18 )
} 
ORDER BY ?lexp ?nurse

PREFIX dc: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> 
PREFIX edtf: <http://data.open.ac.uk/edtf/ontology/>
PREFIX edtfdata: <http://data.open.ac.uk/time/edtf/>
PREFIX event: <http://purl.org/NET/c4dm/event.owl#>
PREFIX led: <http://led.kmi.open.ac.uk/term/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
SELECT (COUNT(DISTINCT ?place) AS ?count) 
WHERE {
   ?lexp event:time [ rdfs:label ?when ; edtf:century edtfdata:Century.19 ; edtf:yearOfCentury/rdf:value ?yoc ]
   VALUES ?nocc { 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/occupation/nurse> 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/thing/QAIMNS+nurse> 
      <http://data.open.ac.uk/led/thing/VAD+nurse> 
   }
   ?lexp <http://purl.org/NET/c4dm/event.owl#place> ?place ; ?p ?nurse
   . ?nurse <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/occupation> ?nocc
   FILTER ( ?yoc >= 14 && ?yoc <= 18 )

} 
ORDER BY ?lexp ?nurse
